prompt: Explain AEK Athens F.C., including information about stadium, league, honors
output: AEK Athens F.C. is a football club based in Athens, Greece. It was founded in 1924 and currently plays in the Super League Greece, the top division of Greek football. The team plays its home games at the Agia Sophia Stadium, also known as OPAP Arena, which holds around 70,000 spectators. AEK Athens has won 12 Greek league titles, 15 Greek Cups, and 2 Greek Super Cups. Internationally, the club reached the UEFA Champions League quarter-finals in 1997–98. Their club colors are yellow and black, and they maintain fierce rivalries with Olympiacos and Panathinaikos.

prompt: Explain A.C. Chievo Verona, including information about stadium, league, honors
output: A.C. Chievo Verona is an Italian football club founded in 1898, based in Verona. The club competes in Serie B, the second tier of Italian football. Their home stadium is Stadio Marc'Antonio Bentegodi, which has a capacity of 39,211. Chievo Verona achieved promotion to Serie A for the first time in 2001. The club has won the Serie B Championship in 1994 and the Serie C1 Championship in 1986. One of their major rivalries is with Hellas Verona, known as the Derby di Verona.

prompt: Explain A.F.C. Blackpool, including information about ground, league, honors
output: A.F.C. Blackpool is a football club located in Blackpool, Lancashire, England. Originally formed as Blackpool Mechanics in 1947, the club now competes in the North West Counties Football League Division One North, the ninth tier of the English football system. Their home ground is Mechanics' Ground on Jepson Way. The team’s colors are black and white stripes. A.F.C. Blackpool has won titles in the West Lancashire Premier Division, notably during the 1999–2000 and 2000–01 seasons, and is known for its strong community engagement.

prompt: Explain A.D. Isidro Metapán, including information about stadium, league, honors
output: A.D. Isidro Metapán is a professional football club based in Metapán, El Salvador. The club was founded in 1929 and plays its home games at Estadio Jorge Calero Suárez, which has a capacity of approximately 10,000 spectators. Isidro Metapán competes in the Primera División de Fútbol de El Salvador, the top tier of Salvadoran football. The team has won 11 league titles and 2 Copa El Salvador trophies. They have also participated in the CONCACAF Champions League. The club has a strong regional presence and is known for its consistent performance domestically.

prompt: Explain Al-Hilal SFC, including information about country, honors, and stadium
output: Al-Hilal SFC is a Saudi Arabian football club based in Riyadh. It is one of the most successful clubs in Asia. Al-Hilal was founded in 1957 and plays at the King Fahd International Stadium, which has a seating capacity of over 68,000. The club has won more than 60 official titles, including numerous Saudi Pro League championships, King Cups, and six AFC titles including the AFC Champions League. Al-Hilal has a large fan base and a storied rivalry with Al-Nassr, known as the Riyadh Derby.

prompt: Explain Boca Juniors, including information about stadium, league, and honors
output: Boca Juniors is a professional football club based in Buenos Aires, Argentina. The club was founded in 1905 and plays its home games at La Bombonera stadium, officially named Estadio Alberto J. Armando, with a capacity of around 54,000. Boca Juniors competes in the Argentine Primera División and is one of the most decorated clubs in South America, having won over 70 official titles, including 6 Copa Libertadores and multiple league championships. Boca’s fierce rivalry with River Plate is known as the Superclásico and is one of the most intense in world football.
